{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3537426,"name":"August Dodge","username":"AandC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/8edcca/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T20:57:13.796Z","cooked":"

Hi! I’m from an FRC rookie team, 10380. We received noodles with our kit, but used them all on one set of bumpers (as expected). Does anyone have any recommendations and/or know what foam material their team uses for the foam padding on their bumpers, and the best and cheapest place to buy it? Thanks so much!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T20:57:13.796Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":43,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":268.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492876,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-material-need-help","display_username":"August Dodge","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-material-need-help/492876/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3537445,"name":"B.Hummel","username":"bhumm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhumm/{size}/148365_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T21:18:01.776Z","cooked":"

Welcome to FRC! With the bumper rule changes this year, you have a lot of options for bumper padding. I am sure many will respond with several good options. However, pool noodles are still an easy option and probably what you want to do now that you have one set already completed. We usually purchase our pool noodles off of amazon, but you need to be careful as many are a slightly smaller diameter (closer to 2") and/or have long shipping time. We have purchased these or these with good success, but shipping is slow for some and they are a lot more expensive than they used to be. AndyMark also sells them but the last time I checked, estimated shipping was high, likely due to the large package size. Of course, you might get lucky looking at your local Walmart, dollar general, or other similar store, or pool supply stores near you. Good luck.

Thank you so much! And thanks for the quick reply. I will check out both of them with my team, but I unfortunately already knew about the Andymark shipping thing with noodles. But thank you!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T01:58:13.358Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492876,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-material-need-help","display_username":"August Dodge","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":41234,"username":"bhumm","name":"B.Hummel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhumm/{size}/148365_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-material-need-help/492876/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537722,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T04:51:51.378Z","cooked":"

There’s a couple of things I want to bring up.

Many teams are using pool noodles (or backer rod, same thing but more size precision) because they’ve got stock from their last big order still, and because they don’t want to be the guinea pigs for new bumper styles.

But, that doesn’t mean you HAVE to use pool noodles. They’re theoretically plentiful and cheap, but there are other options. You do have some time… but let’s look at what else is legal.

–Solid closed-cell foam of two options of material, and each has a density range. For that, you’d figure out a nearby foam store and call them up. Check R402 before calling, obviously.

–Foam floor tiles. The sort of thing you could go to Home Depot (or Harbor Freight) and buy by the box. These would need to be cut to size and stacked and held together, then wrapped.

Don’t get me wrong, the good ol’ pool noodle is still going to be a good friend to you this season, but I’m going to suggest looking at the other options at least with a glance.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T04:51:51.378Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":47.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492876,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-material-need-help","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-material-need-help/492876/4","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3537829,"name":"Robert Underwood","username":"RobLikesRobots","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/roblikesrobots/{size}/265926_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T12:49:36.035Z","cooked":"

If you’re having a hard time acquiring noodles on short notice, you can always make a cover of the other fabric color that you can attach over the bumpers with Velcro in order to run with a single set.

I can provide additional details/instructions if needed.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T12:49:36.035Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492876,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-material-need-help","display_username":"Robert Underwood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23933,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"537 Mentor, Robot Inspector, 269 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-material-need-help/492876/5","custom_user_title":"537 Mentor, Robot Inspector, 269 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3538164,"name":"John Robinson Grace","username":"Tradesurplus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T17:13:26.449Z","cooked":"

More important than the foam is the plywood backing material, it takes a lot more force and abuse. Low quality or recycled degraded plywood is going to break.

If you can afford baltic birch plywood it is far stronger. If you can’t do that very closely inspect you plywood and make sure it doesn’t have voids.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T17:13:26.449Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":89,"readers_count":88,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492876,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-material-need-help","display_username":"John Robinson Grace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-material-need-help/492876/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3538168,"name":"Corbin Kuster","username":"CKioxide","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ckioxide/{size}/235143_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T17:18:47.379Z","cooked":"

We did a layer of 1/2" foam floor tiles to the outside of solid pool noodles. The goal there was to spread out the impact as much as possible before it is absorbed by the noodles. One of our mentors and a couple of new students tested numerous bumper styles in the offseason and found this to be the most effective design. However, after seeing this year’s game, I don’t think regular pool noodle bumpers as everyone has done for years will hurt anyone this year.

Happy to report that my last shipment of these arrived in 4 days (arrived today). It originally had an estimate of 2 weeks. YMMV.
